title: CARES Act Passage
description: Analyze how rapid fiscal policy responses during March 2020 set the stage for the pandemic market rebound.
market_question: Will the CARES Act pass by March 27, 2020?

educational_content.market_context: In March 2020, lawmakers scrambled to pass the $2.2T CARES Act to stem the economic freefall caused by COVID-19 lockdowns.
key_factors: Speed of bipartisan negotiations in Congress
Scale of fiscal stimulus and direct household payments
Coordination with Federal Reserve emergency lending facilities
Market expectations for credit backstops
educational_content.historical_precedents: During the 2008 financial crisis, rapid passage of TARP provided a similar confidence boost, stabilizing credit spreads and supporting risk assets.
educational_content.analysis_framework: Track legislative calendars, whip counts, and public statements from key committee chairs. Combine with credit spread data and central bank announcements to judge passage odds.
learning_objectives: Understand how policy timelines influence market sentiment
Connect fiscal stimulus expectations to equity and credit repricing

title: Bitcoin Year-End Breakout
description: Review how macro narratives and supply dynamics helped Bitcoin eclipse the $20K milestone in 2020.
market_question: Will Bitcoin close above $20,000 on December 31, 2020?

educational_content.market_context: After the May 2020 halving, institutional adoption and macro hedge narratives accelerated Bitcoin's rally into year end.
key_factors: Post-halving supply reductions
Institutional allocation announcements from MicroStrategy and others
US dollar weakness amid aggressive monetary easing
Spot and derivatives market positioning
educational_content.historical_precedents: Previous halving cycles in 2012 and 2016 produced multi-quarter bull runs, though the magnitude and timing varied with macro backdrops.
educational_content.analysis_framework: Track on-chain flows, ETF/OTC desk accumulation, and macro drivers such as real yields. Compare implied probabilities in crypto prediction markets to historical volatility.
learning_objectives: Link crypto supply mechanics to price trajectories
Evaluate how macro liquidity influences digital asset adoption

title: 2020 U.S. Presidential Outcome
description: Examine how polling quality and demographic coalitions shaped the eventual 2020 U.S. election result.
market_question: Will Donald Trump win the 2020 U.S. Presidential Election?

educational_content.market_context: Prediction markets tracked the tight race as late-deciding voters and mail-in ballot counts created sharp probability swings.
key_factors: Swing-state polling averages and error margins
Demographic turnout patterns, especially suburban voters
Impact of COVID-19 handling and economic conditions
Real-time vote count data on election night
educational_content.historical_precedents: Markets mispriced the 2016 election, leading participants to scrutinize poll methodology changes and shifting coalitions in 2020.
educational_content.analysis_framework: Blend polling error scenarios with fundamentals (GDP growth, approval ratings). Stress test outcomes using Electoral College math and early vote data.
learning_objectives: Translate political scenarios into policy-sensitive market moves

title: GameStop Short Squeeze
description: Understand how structural short interest and retail coordination produced the January 2021 GameStop squeeze.
market_question: Will GameStop close above $300 on January 29, 2021?

educational_content.market_context: With short interest exceeding free float, coordinated retail buying on r/WallStreetBets forced aggressive covering by hedge funds.
key_factors: Short interest to float ratios above 100%
Options gamma exposure among market makers
Brokerage margin requirements and collateral constraints
Social media-driven order flow concentration
educational_content.historical_precedents: Past squeezes such as Volkswagen (2008) showed how limited float can trigger runaway price spikes when shorts crowd a trade.
educational_content.analysis_framework: Monitor short interest data, borrow rates, and options positioning. Evaluate liquidity risk from clearinghouses and broker policies that can cap squeezes.
learning_objectives: Recognize structural vulnerabilities that enable squeezes
Assess when positioning, not fundamentals, drives price action

title: Inflation Breaks Above 8%
description: Evaluate how energy shocks and supply chain frictions pushed U.S. inflation to four-decade highs in 2022.
market_question: Will U.S. CPI year-over-year exceed 8% by April 2022?

educational_content.market_context: Persistent supply constraints, elevated energy prices, and strong demand lifted headline CPI to 8.5% in April 2022.
key_factors: Energy price passthrough from the Russia-Ukraine conflict
Goods inventory rebuilds colliding with port congestion
Shelter inflation dynamics and owners' equivalent rent
Fiscal stimulus lingering effects on household demand
educational_content.historical_precedents: The 1970s energy crises similarly pushed inflation well above target, prompting aggressive policy responses from the Federal Reserve.
educational_content.analysis_framework: Track high-frequency indicators like PMI price components, energy futures, and wage growth. Compare market breakevens with realized inflation trends.
learning_objectives: Connect commodity shocks to headline inflation
Anticipate how persistent inflation reshapes central bank policy

title: Brent Above $100 in Q2 2022
description: Study how geopolitical conflict and supply elasticity kept Brent crude prices elevated through mid-2022.
market_question: Will Brent crude average above $100 per barrel in Q2 2022?

educational_content.market_context: Russia's invasion of Ukraine removed significant supply from global markets while OPEC spare capacity remained limited, keeping Brent averages above $100.
key_factors: Russian export disruptions and sanctions
OPEC+ production quotas and spare capacity
Demand recovery as economies reopened post-COVID
Strategic petroleum reserve releases by consuming nations
educational_content.historical_precedents: Geopolitical shocks such as the Gulf War in 1990 similarly drove oil prices sharply higher until alternative supply appeared.
educational_content.analysis_framework: Monitor tanker tracking data, refinery runs, and OPEC meeting guidance. Compare futures curve backwardation to gauge physical tightness.
learning_objectives: Link geopolitical risk to commodity price persistence
Assess supply elasticity and policy responses in energy markets
